title: 25 Years From Tiananmen, China Strives To Keep Activists Silent
teaser: This year marks the 25th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square massacre, and human rights observers say that Chinese authorities are cracking down more than ever on activists and intellectuals. Maya Wang, a researcher with Human Rights Watch, discusses the dubious anniversary and the harsh response that has followed.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
